subject: p14295224
Findings: The lungs are hyperinflated and diaphragms are flattened. An ill-defined opacity in the right upper lobe is persists compared to, and has changed configuration slightly. An 8 mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule is stable. A small right effusion or pleural thickening is unchanged. There is no pneumothorax. Cardiac and mediastinal contours are unchanged, and the patient is status post esophagectomy and gastric pull-through.
Impression: Persistent right upper lobe ill-defined opacity has changed configuration compared to the prior study and may be reflective of recurrent pneumonia or aspiration. Change in interpretation from the preliminary to final report was communicated with Dr phone at on by.
